<JD_START>
Job Title: Inside Sales Specialist

Location: Greater Boston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
This role involves representing CJ and interacting with customers in the North American markets. The responsibilities include understanding the customer’s needs, qualifying leads, managing customer orders, and enhancing their experience to build customer loyalty towards the brand. The position reports to the US Director of Sales WB. The ideal candidate for this role should possess strong relationship-building skills, technical competence in the polymer industries, excellent analytical and communication skills, and the ability to collaborate with teammates to achieve collective results. Job Description and Responsibilities  Develop meaningful relationships with customers to encourage trust and loyalty. Follow-up on cold and warm leads to further the sales process. Understand and demonstrate the products and services to the customer. Set and meet sales goals and objectives set by leadership. Improve sales skills to increase sales success rates.  Act as a liaison with the outside sales team to help support customer administration, such as customer registration, NDA filing, and order fulfillment. Provide problem-solving to resolve any emerging issues the customers may face.  Maintain sales volume, product mix, and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators, and competitors.  Work closely with colleagues in other departments such as finance, marketing, and supply chain.  Partner with customers to understand their business needs and objectives. Effectively communicate the value proposition through proposals and presentations.  Perform other duties as assigned. 
Job Qualifications, Education, and Experience:  Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited four-year college in Business or related field.  A minimum of 3 years of experience in customer service/inside sales in the polymer industry or similar biochemical, biodegradable industries is preferred.  General knowledge of various supply chains and procurement is preferred.  Computer skills, i.e., Microsoft Office Suite; Sales Force.com; SAP preferred.  Must be able to maintain confidentiality. In-office required 4 out of 5 days.   Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities  Ability to interact at multiple levels and departments in large, complex organizations.  Ability to communicate effectively and participate in a continuous improvement culture, including problem-solving skills.  Strong business acumen, interpersonal professional interaction, fluency in project processes and problem-solving, and presentation skills.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to present technical data.  Willingness to perform a variety of duties in a new team; strong organizational skills, especially in limited resources setting preferred.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
